parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A gift, present. A present; specially, a sacrifice.
(a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.
From en and pros; in front of (literally or figuratively) or time).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An altar (for sacrifice). From a derivative of thusia; a place of sacrifice, i.e. An altar.
First, in the first place, before, formerly. Neuter of protos as adverb; firstly.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To go away, depart, begone, die. From hupo and ago; to lead under, i.e. Withdraw or retire, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From dia and allasso; to change thoroughly, i.e. to conciliate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From pros and phero; to bear towards, i.e. Lead to, tender, treat.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A gift, present. A present; specially, a sacrifice.
